parliament.translation[0].definitions[0]: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs
They demanded a free parliament and press.
parliament.translation[0].definitions[1]: the period during which the British Parliament meets
We expect to get these laws passed during the present parliament.
parliament.translation[0].note_box[0].se: be elected to parliament
She was elected to parliament in 1997.
stand for parliament
Ms Jackson stood for Parliament as a Labour candidate.
enter/get into parliament
Tony Blair first entered Parliament in 1983.
be returned to Parliament
Creevey was returned to Parliament as MP for Appleby.
a bill is passed by parliament
The bill was passed by Parliament last May.
a bill goes through parliament
The bill is currently going through Parliament.
go before/be put before parliament
The Bill goes before Parliament on November 16.
dissolve parliament
The prime minister will ask the Queen to dissolve Parliament and call an election.
a member of parliament
He was the Conservative member of Parliament for Edgbaston.
an act of parliament
Their rights are guaranteed by Act of Parliament.
a seat in parliament
If Morgan resigns his seat in Parliament, there will be a bye-election.
a session of parliament
The Queen opened a new session of Parliament last week.
the lifetime of a parliament
We shall not make changes in this area, at least in the lifetime of this Parliament.
parliament.translation[0].note_box[1].it: In meanings 1 and 2, parliament is usually followed by a singular verb
Parliament has been unable to agree
Parliament have been unable to agree
parliament.translation[1].definitions[0]: the main law-making institution in the UK, which consists of the House of Commons and the House of Lords
The government has actually increased its majority in Parliament.
parliament.translation[2].definitions[0]: the group of people elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national issues
The Dutch parliament voted to begin lifting economic sanctions.
